current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To protect individual privacy against unwarranted
		  governmental intrusion through the use of the unmanned aerial vehicles commonly
		  called drones, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Preserving Freedom from
			 Unwarranted Surveillance Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

term.#tail:
has the meaning
			 given the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 331 of the FAA
			 Modernization and Reform Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012/s:331

term.#tail:
means a person or entity authorized by law, or funded by the Government of the
			 United States, to investigate or prosecute offenses against the United
			 States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a person or entity acting under the authority, or funded in whole
			 or in part by, the Government of the United States shall not use a drone to
			 gather evidence or other information pertaining to criminal conduct or conduct
			 in violation of a statute or regulation except to the extent authorized in a
			 warrant that satisfies the requirements of the Fourth Amendment to the
			 Constitution of the United States.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Freedom from Unwarranted Surveillance Act of 2013/s:4

text.#text:
This Act does not prohibit any of the
			 following:

The use of a drone to patrol national borders to prevent
			 or deter illegal entry of any persons or illegal substances.

The use of a drone by a law enforcement party when
			 exigent circumstances exist. For the purposes of this paragraph, exigent
			 circumstances exist when the law enforcement party possesses reasonable
			 suspicion that under particular circumstances, swift action to prevent imminent
			 danger to the life of an individual is necessary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines credible
			 intelligence indicates there is such a risk.

text.#text:
The use of a drone to
			 counter a high risk of a terrorist attack by a specific individual or
			 organization, when the

Any aggrieved party
			 may in a civil action obtain all appropriate relief to prevent or remedy a
			 violation of this Act.

No evidence
			 obtained or collected in violation of this Act may be admissible as evidence in
			 a criminal prosecution in any court of law in the United States.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1016 IS: Preserving Freedom from Unwarranted Surveillance Act of 2013
